title: [Self-Directed] Virtual Reality (VR)-Integrated Instructional Design for Medical Education Innovation: Enhancing Social Interaction and Patient-Centered Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Basic understanding of medical procedures, experience with digital devices, and familiarity with fundamental concepts of patient rights and medical ethics.
context.additional_context: A practice-oriented educational environment using smartphone-based VR solutions, with scenario designs reflecting medical social contexts (doctor-patient relationships, interdisciplinary team collaboration, cultural sensitivity).

learning_goals: Learners enhance cognitive problem-solving and social relationship management within medical teams by performing ≥3 complex medical simulations (e.g., ER scenarios, post-operative recovery management, interdisciplinary care collaboration) using VR technology

Learners complete three immersive VR patient interaction scenarios (e.g., pain-complaining patients, dementia patients, pediatric patients) by Week 4 of a 6-month course, achieving ≥4.0 average on 4 emotional empathy scale items (empathic response, emotional understanding, nonverbal response, situational coping) using a 5-point Likert scale to evaluate patient-caregiver relationship-building skills

Learners achieve ≥80% proficiency in two medical skills (e.g., injection administration, wound care) using smartphone-based VR tools, demonstrating ≥90% compliance with medical protocols and patient safety management standards

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
